title: Is Ekko "Overloaded"?
body:
This is a buzzword that has been tossed around a lot in the last year and a half, but it's been a little while since I've heard it. But this is the first time I've ever considered using it myself. Let's review...

Passive: Slow every 3rd attack, and on champions includes a "strong" move speed buff

Q: damage, slow

W: passively basic attacks do bonus damage to low health targets, plus  an active which creates an aoe slow zone that detonates if he enters, granting him a shield and stunning all targets inside

E: Initial dash, increased attack range, and targeted blink

R: Rewinds time, becoming untargetable and invulnerable appearing where he was a few seconds ago, and regaining a portion of hp lost over those seconds...."while dealing tons of damage to all nearby enemies".

On an assassin. It SOUNDS like a lot of crowd control. But I supposed numbers will be everything here.

EDIT: note here ult is actually a TINY bit disappointing considering it's depiction in the teaser. Many people expected, considering how replays are often done in these games to save space -that is literally "recreating" the game action by action from a small kilobytes sized file- that the game would not only record for replays but be able to support a character that could literally rewind game time  for EVERYONE enabling it to play out differently.  (That and we could finally get replays)
